intro: Eugenia barrana, commonly known as the Barraná guava, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruit, which is typically edible, is often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine. Eugenia barrana plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
